author: Alexandra Harris
title: Grilled calamari salad with yoghurt and ouzo dressing
ingredients: 1.2 kg baby calamari (200gm each), cleaned, hoods and tentacles separated
¼ cup (loosely packed) small basil leaves, plus extra to serve
Pita bread, pickled peppers and baby Greek basil, to serve
1.2 kg baby calamari (200gm each), cleaned, hoods and tentacles separated
¼ cup (loosely packed) small basil leaves, plus extra to serve
Pita bread, pickled peppers and baby Greek basil, to serve

instructions_list: To marinate calamari, halve hood lengthways. Place oil and oregano in a small bowl, season to taste and stir to combine. Place calamari hoods and tentacles in a large bowl with half oregano mixture, season to taste and toss gently to coat. Marinate for 1 hour.
Meanwhile, for yoghurt and ouzo dressing, combine ingredients in a small bowl, season to taste and stir to combine.
Combine tomato and olives in a bowl with remaining oregano mixture. Season to taste and toss to combine.

Preheat a lightly greased barbecue or char-grill pan to high. Thread calamari hoods in an “S” shape onto skewers. Cook skewers and tentacles, turning frequently, until charred and cooked (3-5 minutes).
Place tomato salad on a serving platter, arrange calamari on top and scatter with basil. Drizzle with yoghurt and ouzo dressing. Serve with pita bread and pickled peppers, on the side.
description: A calamari salad perfect for your next alfresco feast.
